messages.content: What is the purpose of the Human-parser-comfyui-node?
The purpose of the Human-parser-comfyui-node is to provide an out-of-the-box human parsing representation extractor for various downstream applications.
On which dataset does the SCHP solution rank 1st?
The SCHP solution ranks 1st for all human parsing tracks, including single, multiple and video, in the third LIP challenge.
Which pretrained models are available for human parsing?
Pretrained models are available for three popular datasets: LIP, ATR, and Pascal-Person-Part.
How can I extract human parsing representations using the SCHP models?
To extract human parsing representations, place your own images in the 'INPUT_PATH' folder, download a pretrained model, and run the 'simple_extractor.py' command with the appropriate arguments.
What is the command-line option to save the output feature maps?
The command-line option to save the output feature maps is '--logits'.
How do I set up the environment for the Human-parser-comfyui-node?

First, create the conda environment using 'conda env create -f environment.yaml'. Then, activate the environment with 'conda activate schp' and install the required packages with 'pip install -r requirements.txt'.
Where can I find the dataset preparation instructions for LIP?
The dataset preparation instructions for LIP can be found under the 'Dataset Preparation' section of the documentation.
How can I train a model using the Human-parser-comfyui-node?
To train a model, use the 'train.py' command. The trained model will be saved in the './log' directory.
How can I evaluate a model using the Human-parser-comfyui-node?
To evaluate a model, use the 'evaluate.py' command and provide the path to the trained model using the '--model-restore' option.
How can I extend the Human-parser-comfyui-node for multiple human parsing tasks?
To extend the Human-parser-comfyui-node for multiple human parsing tasks, please refer to the '[MultipleHumanParsing.md](./mhp_extension/README.md)' file for more details.
How do I cite the Human-parser-comfyui-node if I use it in my research?

To cite the Human-parser-comfyui-node in your research, please use the following LaTeX citation: '@article{li2020self, title={Self-Correction for Human Parsing}, author={Li, Peike and Xu, Yunqiu and Wei, Yunchao and Yang, Yi}, journal={IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence}, year={2020}, doi={10.1109/TPAMI.2020.3048039}}'.
